intro.title: Is there a devil?
intro.description: Relativism proposes that all our beliefs are conditioned on specific cultural circumstances, which may vary and affect reality. This view may even work for some issues, but not so with the reality of “evil.” He is real, has been and is present in all places and situations.

appendix.appendixContent:
Psalms 53:3

3 Every one of them has turned aside; They have together become corrupt; There is none who does good, No, not one.

questions.description: Looking at the world around us, the picture Paul describes is discouraging. He notices the presence of evil and suffering throughout creation by saying that “nature groans” waiting for redemption (Romans 8:22). The psalmist (Psalm 53:3) completes the picture by dissecting human nature and declaring his failure, saying that there is no one doing good. Evil is pervaded in the human race.
questions.questionTitle: Evil is real and is present everywhere. Think about it and answer the question below.
questions.questionVersicles: Read Romans 8:22 and Psalm 53:3 and mark true or false on the following statements:

answers.text: The psalmist says no one does good

appendix.appendixContent:
John 10:10

10 The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.

John 8:44

44 You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of it.

questions.description: This evil world and evil-inclined nature we inherited had an original cause or causer. Jesus said that Satan was a “murdered from the beginning” of creation (John 8:44) and always intended to “kill, steal and destroy” (John 10:10).
questions.questionTitle: Who was the original cause of evil?
questions.questionAppendix: Read John 8:44 to answer

appendix.appendixContent:
I Peter 5:8

8 Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.

Job 2:7

7 So Satan went out from the presence of the Lord, and struck Job with painful boils from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head.

I Peter 5:8

8 Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.

questions.description: The account of Job’s life is evidence of Satan’s thirst for harming God’s children (Job 2:7). Peter adds in one of his letters (1 Peter 5:8) that the Enemy lives in search of a way to end people’s lives. He specializes in it! We cannot deny his existence and his destructive power.
questions.questionTitle: Job’s story is a good example of Satan’s destructive role. This account is evidence that Satan:
questions.questionAppendix: Read Job 2:7 and 1 Peter 5:8 to answer

answers.text: Lives in search of ending people’s lives
